item.title: I like the idea of "making" photographs rather than "taking" photographs. Making is much more personal. Implying care and attention to detail, rather than just grabbing the moment recklessly.
item.description:
I like the idea of "making" photographs rather than "taking" photographs. Making is much more personal. Implying care and attention to detail, rather than just grabbing the moment recklessly.

Ansel Adams' name is synonymous with landscape photography, but a new interview with Adams' daughter-in-law Jeanne reveals more about a lesser known side of his work. The long-time CEO of the Ansel Adams Gallery talks with Advancing Your Photography's Marc Silber, discussing the legendary photographer's portraiture and architectural imagery, and shares some stories of Adams' interactions with his workshop participants.

item.title: Drone footage of aurora over Iceland is just what your weekend needs
item.description:
Drone footage of aurora over Iceland is just what your weekend needs

Maybe it's unreasonably hot where you live, like it is here. Maybe you just smashed your phone screen on a sidewalk (and you KNEW you should have paid for that Apple Care). It's none of our business why, but if your troubled mind needs soothing, we found just the thing for it: this video of the Northern Lights shot from a drone soaring over Iceland.

item.title: Competition has to be good for the end user.
item.description:
Competition has to be good for the end user.

Intel's new licensing deal allowing it to manufacture ARM-based chips for smartphones could win over Apple as a customer in as little as two years, placing pressure on current A-series chip manufacturer TSMC, according to Nikkei Asian Review .

item.title: I always thought they should be capitalised. But then I also know that capitalised is not spelled capitalized!
item.description:
I always thought they should be capitalised. But then I also know that capitalised is not spelled capitalized!

The general rule says that seasons should not be capitalized. They are common nouns, not proper nouns. But there are a few exceptions that call for capitalization. Capitalize the name of a season when it's the first word of a sentence or part of a proper noun.

item.title: Nauseation …
item.description:
Nauseation …

Nauseous means causing nausea or tummy troubles, and nauseated means feeling sick-even though the two are often used to mean the same thing. Think of this guide as the Pepto-Bismol to the upset stomach of confusable words, and read on for the definition, spelling, and usage of nauseous and nauseated.

item.title: This is a post.
item.description:
This is a post.

A post with a picture. Pictures -and posts- are good. Pictures inside posts are even better.
